definition: banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

sentences.english: Hang all your leafy banners out!
sentences.chinese: 升起你全部木叶如同旌旗招展。

sentences.english: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.
sentences.chinese: 你把旌旗赐给敬畏你的人，可以为真理杨起来。

sentences.english: The plane homed in on the radio beacon.
sentences.chinese: 飞机按照导航台旌旗灯号下降。

sentences.english: When their flags and pennants are in chaos, their men and horses frequently shifting about, then strike into them.
sentences.chinese: 敌人旌旗紊乱，人马不断调动，就来机攻破它。

sentences.english: Monitors the wet warning valve pressure switch's operation signal.
sentences.chinese: 监督干式报警阀压力开闭地行动旌旗灯号。

sentences.english: The role of phase shifter is signal phase shift from another perspective.
sentences.chinese: 移相器地感化是将旌旗灯号地相位挪动一个角度。

sentences.english: The ship gave out radio signals for help.
sentences.chinese: 船发出无线电旌旗灯号告急。

sentences.english: The grandfather of them all: The Banner of Truth Trust .
sentences.chinese: 这一切的元老就是真理旌旗出版社。

definition: emperor's or general's banner erected on an ivory-tipped pole at a military camp or headquarters (in ancient times)
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
smoke signal indicating the presence of hostile forces
lit. people shouting and horses neighing (idiom)/fig. tumultuous/hubbub
soldier's copper saucepan, used for cooking food by day and for sounding the night watches during the hours of darkness (in ancient times)
